name: NPR
text:
The pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai was released on bail in Hong Kong — nearly 3 weeks after he was arrested and subsequently charged under China's new Hong Kong national security law.
https://t.co/qrGFuY9y8N

name: NPR
text:
New York City will deploy sheriff's deputies to enforce quarantine protocols for travelers arriving from the U.K. — a new measure aimed at preventing the spread of a new coronavirus variant sweeping London.
https://t.co/U517lIuYY3

name: NPR
text:
Advocates are imploring the incoming Biden administration to urgently undo many Trump immigration policies.

"We have people literally dying...all over Mexico because of those policies that stop them from coming up for asylum," one nonprofit director said.
https://t.co/E0fCrVenfx

name: NPR
text:
Instead of helping "prevent the diversion of prescription opioids," a DOJ prosecutor says, Walmart "did the opposite — filling thousands of invalid prescriptions at its pharmacies and failing to report suspicious orders."
https://t.co/tvoABevQ9V

name: NPR
text:
We're tracking President-elect Joe Biden's cabinet nominees and advisers. Here's a look at how the administration is shaping up so far.
https://t.co/gdwxf0l3Ea

name: NPR
text:
48 states, plus Puerto Rico and D.C., have unchecked community spread of the coronavirus.

A look at the country's numbers, as of this morning:

📈 Total cases: 18,237,039
📈 2-week trend: +3.3%

📈 Total deaths: 322,846
📈 2-week trend: +22.4% 
https://t.co/9mIy0dl1cp

name: NPR
text:
"I had never imagined that Trump or any other politician would affect American justice," says Hassan Salman, who was shot in the Blackwater massacre in Baghdad.

President Trump pardoned 4 ex-guards convicted in the massacre that killed 14 Iraqi civilians.
https://t.co/XrCMdLTGzj

name: NPR
text:
RT @npratc: Antarctica is no longer the only continent free of the pandemic after 36 people tested positive for the coronavirus at a permanent research station.
https://t.co/e326xBySLn

name: NPR
text:
Here are some ideas to up your pandemic baking, holiday-style 😋
https://t.co/GDg071SUtc

name: NPR
text: RT @planetmoney: There have only been 7 COVID deaths in Taiwan. This entire time. Sure, it's an island, but it's also trying new things with technology. Today's episode: how Taiwan hacked the pandemic. https://t.co/d7DLhKYjbj

name: NPR
text:
Don't worry, Virginia, COVID-19 won't stop Santa Claus. 

The nation's top infectious disease specialist is on the case. https://t.co/SUsvGW3LYM

name: NPR
text:
"It's been unbearable."

"We've been bombed."

"It's a tsunami."

"Boxes from wall to wall."

Postal service workers are grappling with an unprecedented volume of packages — estimated to be 40% more than normal this year.
https://t.co/A1o85bCy6J

name: NPR
text:
A white Columbus police officer who fatally shot a Black man less than 10 seconds after finding him in a garage is now on paid administrative leave.

It’s the city’s second law enforcement shooting of a Black man this month.
https://t.co/WjQ0kgdKBU

name: NPR
text:
Twitter will reset the official @POTUS account to 0 followers after President-elect Biden takes over on Inauguration Day — a departure from the last presidential transition.

Biden's team is pushing back against the decision.
https://t.co/IQKZREqugP

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden acknowledged it could take months to undo many Trump administration immigration policies — but advocates are imploring the incoming administration to move urgently.

"This is a matter of life and death," one nonprofit director said.
https://t.co/8LfWVuEeqo

name: NPR
text:
Here are some of our favorite NPR comics of the year — on everything from how to explain the pandemic to kids to helping older people in your life.
https://t.co/3uT0dT2lGr

name: NPR
text:
The U.N. Human Rights Office says it's "deeply concerned" by Trump's pardon of 4 ex-Blackwater guards convicted in the killing of 14 Iraqi civilians in 2007.

"Pardoning them ... has the effect of emboldening others to commit such crimes in the future."
https://t.co/o8PItRQHuO

name: NPR
text:
The Postal Service has been hit with an unprecedented volume of packages — so many that not even 50,000 extra temporary workers hired this season are enough to keep up.

Some clerks are working 11-hour days, 6 days a week.
https://t.co/Ks0TVAKH9M

name: NPR
text: A U.S. cybersecurity agency said Wednesday that the far-reaching attack into the IT management company SolarWinds discovered earlier this month has infected more systems than previously thought. https://t.co/EO0kD2zGcb

name: NPR
text: Public health experts say the idea of enlisting respected and well-known leaders to help explain the health message is exactly the right way to disarm and persuade skeptics. https://t.co/beuWW7gIIp

name: NPR
text: Did the residents of St. Joseph’s die just from COVID-19 or did their forced evacuation play a role? NPR Investigates the decision to move 78 older adults to a new facility. Was it a mistake? https://t.co/ZzV3VHLoW0

name: NPR
text: "We have no ICU beds," says Brad Spellberg, chief medical officer of LAC+USC Medical Center, one of the area's largest hospitals. "We are just continually, 24 hours a day, scrambling to move patients around. The flood just continues." https://t.co/eavYdR99t0

name: NPR
text:
When COVID-19 cases increased in New Jersey again this fall, a volunteer ambulance crew in the epicenter of the state's spring outbreak held its breath, waiting for what they thought would be an inevitable spike in calls, too.

They're still waiting. https://t.co/rsg8VPNuaC

name: NPR
text:
RT @hansilowang: All I want for Christmas are tips about the 2020 census post-collection processing schedule.*

Sincerely,

Your @NPR Census Reporter, who can be reached at hwang@npr.org, hansilowang@protonmail.com and 917-397-2639 (via text and Signal)

*ᴬⁿᵈ ⁿᵒ ᵐᵒʳᵉ ᵖᵃⁿᵈᵉᵐᶦᶜˢAll I want for Christmas are tips about the 2020 census post-collection processing schedule.*

Sincerely,

Your… https://t.co/5euEvlHJG1

name: NPR
text:
Think you're stressed out during the holidays? Try being one of Santa's little helpers. 

Writer David Sedaris continues the holiday tradition of a reading from his collection of stories titled the Santaland Diaries. https://t.co/WKrHYmKmgf

name: NPR
text: With only a week left in 2020, now is the time to make your support for NPR and public radio known. Donate to the NPR station in your community today and make another year of reliable reporting possible! https://t.co/LzgHFrLiTo https://t.co/zOwRaOgHQM

name: NPR
text: China's market regulator announced Thursday that it had opened an investigation into the country's e-commerce giant, Alibaba, for alleged anti-competitive activities. https://t.co/MesEvRCGxq

name: NPR
text:
RT @davidfolkenflik: “The Daily” host Michael Barbaro interviewed NYT executive editor Dean Baquet as part of paper’s push to restore trust after “Caliphate” collapsed. 

Barbaro’s undisclosed ties to “Caliphate” crew and actions off the air muddied the waters. 
 
My story: 
https://t.co/ktXf4XwUr1

name: NPR
text: The pandemic is driving a dramatic drop in the proportion of students going on to college, threatening the already precarious economies of rural areas and widening their socioeconomic drift from urban and suburban America. https://t.co/zwL0M0Dsxt

name: NPR
text: Ken Dornstein has dedicated his life to searching for the truth behind the bombing of Pam Am Flight 103. In his 2015 documentary series My Brother's Bomber, he revealed links that eventually led to the indictment of suspected bomb expert Abu Agela Mas'ud. https://t.co/11RtT9h4Kz
